intro: Helladia cretica, commonly known as the Mediterranean thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and bract structures. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands. Its leaves are spiny and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters. Helladia cretica is known for its resilience to drought and its role in supporting local insect populations.
